rape. Admittedly she did not voluntarily do anything to bring about the ex-
istence of a child. Admittedly she did nothing at all which would give the
unborn person a right to the use of her body. All the same it might well be
said, as in the newly emended violinist story, that she oughtto allow it to re-
main for that hour—that it would be indecent of her to refuse. . . .
So my own view is that even though you ought to let the violinist use
your kidneys for the one hour he needs
